screen_desc: The screenshot shows the "Apps & notifications" settings on an Android phone. It displays recently opened apps (Contacts, Gmail, and Photos) with their last usage times. Below, it shows options for managing notifications, default apps (Chrome, Phone, and Messages), and permission settings for apps. There's an advanced section for emergency alerts and special app access. The user can view all 34 apps from the link provided.
action_think: The user wants to toggle the option to show notifications on the lock screen. Based on the current screen, the relevant section for managing notifications is displayed. The next step is to locate the setting for lock screen notifications under the 'Notifications' section, which appears to be the most appropriate area for this setting.
action_plan: Click on the 'Notifications' section to access its settings.
Look for an option to control lock screen notifications.
Toggle the option to enable or disable notifications on the lock screen as per the user's request.
action_result:
By clicking on the "Notifications" menu item, the screen has transitioned to the Notifications settings section, which allows access to various notification preferences. In the current screen, you can see options like "Recently Sent" notifications, as well as settings related to lock screen notifications.

This action has made progress towards completing the user request because you are now in the correct section to toggle notification visibility on the lock screen. To fully complete the request, the next step would be to locate and toggle the setting that controls whether notifications are shown on the lock screen, which appears to be accessible in this section.
